body:

I come with a story. A story of a man that was once one of the mythical few who called themselves Galio mains. That man was me. I knew how to use his strengths to their best, and I love both his personality and lore. Playing a Gargoyle just seemed so neat to me, even if few others seemed to share my opinion. I was content to be one of few people to enjoy the tanky support-mage that was Galio.

Then a rework was announced. I was excited at first, I knew Galio was dated both in the way he played and with how he looked. I was hopeful this rework would do the great stone gargoyle justice! I was confident... Nay, I was convinced this would be a great thing for me and my favorite champion! But I was horribly wrong.

When I first saw the teaser for the new Galio I became worried. This didn't look much like the Galio I knew... But it was a teaser! I didn't see the full horror of it all until he was fully revealed. What I saw was not Galio, but a brand new champion with Galio's name. He had little to nothing of what I loved in the old Galio. His look was changed, his lore was changed, his personality was changed. He was not the Galio I knew anymore. 

Truly, I believe this new Galio was a wonderful addition to the game however! His lore was fantastic, his look was nice, his personality was entertaining... But he is not Galio. He is not a gargoyle. He is not a tragic character grieving over being unable to protect his creator. He is not a wise, but witty grotesque statue. He is a great colossus who is heroic and legendary. 

But I will never stop missing the champion they removed from the game under the guise of a rework. I will never forget the champion I once loved and mained. I will always remember the real Galio.

Yeah I don't like what they did with Pantheon's lore. "Oh, let's explain this huge long backstory about how he scaled the mountain and why...lol just kidding, he got taken over by some cosmic entity." Like, what? How is that gonna work with Pantheon's old personality? Why wouldn't they just make Pantheon an honorary title and let the poor man keep his backstory? Seems strange.

I know, right? And all of the Targ champions are like this to greater and lesser degrees. Hell the old lores were building to a confrontation of religions and a change of the hierarchy of the entire mountain. 

The new lore says "fuck all that" and instead focuses on a damn space empire that comes out of nowhere in the end of all the lores. That's way less interesting. 

And really annoying, I actually liked Atreus. It showed the troubles of going through an agoge system. He had drive, it was a bit cliched but whatever. And the scene on top of the mountain where his only friend dies and the very gods abandon him? That was actually a pretty powerful scene. 

But then, nope. He dies and a space parasite possesses his body. What horseshit.

Considering that i loved every Rework Riot has done in the past (even for champions that i don't play myself), i don't have a reason to believe Riot will fuck it up. The Rework process has the same dedicated resources and time constraint as new champions so essentially, Riot IS making a new champion with a preexisting template. They're not half-assing the effort.
With the Rework in mind, i am fully aware that Eve's lore is likely to change (finally moving out of her "assassin for hire" trope) as well as her VO and model.

If Riot correctly identfitied Eve's core pillars that they rebuilt her upon, i wouldn't care if her look from what we have now changes. If she works and there's a thematic cohesiveness in her kit + lore, i welcome new Eve with open arms. That's how i feel.

#Morgana

I am now a support Morgana main and Riot has said they would like to do an eventual duo update to Kayle and Morgana. I can't find anything wrong with Morg's current kit but even if it works, it's pretty OK. Just OK. She isn't anything special/flashy that you can complain about/praise. And that's the issue. I feel the same thing as with Eve. If Riot identifies Morgana's core pillars correctly, rebuilding her around them would give us an improved Morgana that everyone is already familiar with.

You can't really express your mastery as a Morgana player outside of only being good at predicting the Q bindings really well. And that's a skill that's pretty easily acquired. New Morgana players have  ~7% higher win rate with her than masterful players with 200+ games on her. That's pretty wrong in my opinion. This means that Morgana currently isn't a good champion to one trick in general as you play her more, you run into a wall.

_Considering that Xayah and Rakan were released in pairs (two champions), i think Riot has fair experience on duo releases so Kayle and Morgana wouldn't look like experiments._
